title: Mutually Exclusive Events
text: The events “landing on green” and “landing on red” are mutually exclusive because they cannot occur at the same time.
speech: The events “landing on green” and “landing on red” are mutually exclusive because they cannot occur at the same time.
pacedSpeech: The events “landing on green” and “landing on red” are mutually exclusive because they cannot occur at the same time.

title: Sample Space
text: There are $$8$$ total areas where the arrow can land on.
speech: There are  8  total areas where the arrow can land on.
pacedSpeech: total areas where the arrow can land on.

title: Landing on Green
text: There are $$2$$ slices in the circle that the arrow can land on: the I and the F.
speech: There are  2  slices in the circle that the arrow can land on: the I and the F.
pacedSpeech: slices in the circle that the arrow can land on: the I and the F.

title: Landing on Red
text: There is only $$1$$ slice in the circle that the arrow can land on.
speech: There is only  1  slice in the circle that the arrow can land on.
pacedSpeech: slice in the circle that the arrow can land on.

title: Landing on a Green Vowel
text: There is only $$1$$ slice in the circle that the arrow can land on: the green I.
speech: There is only  1  slice in the circle that the arrow can land on: the green I.
pacedSpeech: slice in the circle that the arrow can land on: the green I.

title: Addition
text: Add the probability of landing on green with the probability of landing on red.
speech: Add the probability of landing on green with the probability of landing on red.
pacedSpeech: Add the probability of landing on green with the probability of landing on red.
